subject: Re: Executing dynamic tests
msgSnippet: ... hope it ... Actually, your advice sent me down a better path yesterday.  I ended up looking at how RepeatedTest and TestSetup were implemented. What I
messageBody:
>
> I believe that I understood enough to give you better advice. I
hope it
> helps.

Actually, your advice sent me down a better path yesterday. I ended
up looking at how RepeatedTest and TestSetup were implemented.

What I ended up doing was extending TestSetup and overriding run().
run() called setUp() once to handle the database connection. Then
a "big ugly" loop get each object and uses the ResourceManager object
from the jUnit Extensions package to wrap up the record. Then called
basicRun(). Each pass through the loop calls basicRun(), so that the
TestSuite passed into this object would be run on each record.
Called it RecordIteratorTestSetup.

Then, I just created a TestCase where I used the
RecordIteratorTestSetup, passed in the value of the batch, and ran a
standard test.

The standard test (one that I want to repeat for many customers),
simply is smart enough that on setUp() it grabs the Record from the
ResourceManager.

And it worked...and there was much rejoicing.

I'm not sure if this implementation is ideal, but it seems to work so
far. I really appreciate the help, because it got me thinking about
this a bit differently and pushed me down the right track.
